intro: Spergularia lebeliana, commonly known as the Lebel's sandspurry, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and can tolerate high levels of salinity and drought. Its reproductive strategy involves producing small, capsule-like fruits that release seeds through mechanical means. Spergularia lebeliana plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
